definition: to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
difficult/hard/hardship

sentences.english: Many years later, Susan became a difficult person.
sentences.chinese: 很多年之後，素心成了舉步維艱的人。

sentences.english: Are you finding it hard to face life on your own?
sentences.chinese: 是否獨自面對的生活讓你覺得舉步維艱？

sentences.english: Today we will look at the results of slogging through life under that extra weight.
sentences.chinese: 結果今天我們將看到在不必要的重負下生活舉步維艱。

sentences.english: Jung learned just how difficult in the fall of 2005.
sentences.chinese: 2005年秋季對彬嫺來說，真可謂是舉步維艱。

sentences.english: That made our life very hard.
sentences.chinese: 這使公司發展舉步維艱。

sentences.english: Sir Alex Ferguson admits a glut of injuries has unsettled Manchester United this season.
sentences.chinese: 弗格森爵士承認傷兵滿營讓球隊舉步維艱。

sentences.english: Aircraft production continued to plod along at an agonizingly slow pace.
sentences.chinese: 飛機制造業仍舊舉步維艱，發展速度之緩很讓人頭疼。

sentences.english: The force of reaction made change difficult.
sentences.chinese: 反動勢力使得改革舉步維艱。

definition: not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
high pressure/bearing a heavy weight
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
circumstances
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
chain reaction
isolated and without help
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to no avail/of no use
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
fatigued/exhausted/poverty-stricken/in straitened circumstances
fair competition
